verses.kjv: And when he had called unto him his twelve disciples, he gave them power against unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal all manner of sickness and all manner of disease.
verses.ct: Jesus called his 12 disciples together and gave them authority over evil spirits, enabling them to drive them out and to heal every kind of sickness and disease.

verses.kjv: Now the names of the twelve apostles are these; The first, Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother; James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother;
verses.ct: Here are the names of the 12 apostles: first, Simon (also called Peter) and his brother Andrew; James son of Zebedee and his brother John;

verses.kjv: Philip, and Bartholomew; Thomas, and Matthew the publican; James the son of Alphaeus, and Lebbaeus, whose surname was Thaddaeus;
verses.ct: Philip and Bartholomew; Thomas and Matthew the tax collector; James son of Alphaeus and Lebbaeus (also known as Thaddaeus);

verses.kjv: Simon the Canaanite, and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him.
verses.ct: Simon the Canaanite and Judas Iscariot, who later betrayed him.

verses.kjv: These twelve Jesus sent forth, and commanded them, saying, Go not into the way of the Gentiles, and into any city of the Samaritans enter ye not:
verses.ct: Jesus sent these 12 out with these instructions: "Don't go to Gentile regions, and don't enter any Samaritan town.

verses.kjv: But go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
verses.ct: Instead, go to the lost sheep of the people of Israel.

verses.kjv: And as ye go, preach, saying, The kingdom of heaven is at hand.
verses.ct: As you travel, proclaim this message: 'The kingdom of heaven is near.'

verses.kjv: Heal the sick, cleanse the lepers, raise the dead, cast out devils: freely ye have received, freely give.
verses.ct: Heal those who are sick, cure those with leprosy, raise the dead, and drive out demons. You received without paying, so give without charging.

verses.kjv: Provide neither gold, nor silver, nor brass in your purses,
verses.ct: Don't take along gold, silver, or copper coins in your money belts.

verses.kjv: Nor scrip for your journey, neither two coats, neither shoes, nor yet staves: for the workman is worthy of his meat.
verses.ct: Don't carry a bag for the trip, or an extra shirt, or sandals, or a walking stick — because a worker deserves to be provided for.

verses.kjv: And into whatsoever city or town ye shall enter, enquire who in it is worthy; and there abide till ye go thence.
verses.ct: Whatever city or town you enter, find out who there is worthy of hosting you, and stay with them until you leave.

verses.kjv: And when ye come into an house, salute it.
verses.ct: When you enter a home, offer it your greeting of peace.

verses.kjv: And if the house be worthy, let your peace come upon it: but if it be not worthy, let your peace return to you.
verses.ct: If the household is deserving, let your peace rest on it. But if it isn't deserving, let your peace come back to you.

verses.kjv: And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear your words, when ye depart out of that house or city, shake off the dust of your feet.
verses.ct: If anyone refuses to welcome you or listen to your message, leave that house or town and shake the dust off your feet as you go.

verses.kjv: Verily I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment, than for that city.
verses.ct: I tell you the truth, on judgment day it will be more bearable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah than for that town.

verses.kjv: Behold, I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves: be ye therefore wise as serpents, and harmless as doves.
verses.ct: Pay attention — I'm sending you out like sheep among wolves. So be as shrewd as snakes and as innocent as doves.

verses.kjv: But beware of men: for they will deliver you up to the councils, and they will scourge you in their synagogues;
verses.ct: Watch out for people, because they will hand you over to local courts and whip you in their synagogues.

verses.kjv: And ye shall be brought before governors and kings for my sake, for a testimony against them and the Gentiles.
verses.ct: You will be dragged in front of governors and kings because of me, as a witness to them and to the Gentiles.

verses.kjv: But when they deliver you up, take no thought how or what ye shall speak: for it shall be given you in that same hour what ye shall speak.
verses.ct: But when they hand you over, don't worry about how to speak or what to say. The right words will be given to you at that moment.

verses.kjv: For it is not ye that speak, but the Spirit of your Father which speaketh in you.
verses.ct: It won't really be you speaking — it will be the Spirit of your Father speaking through you.

verses.kjv: And the brother shall deliver up the brother to death, and the father the child: and the children shall rise up against their parents, and cause them to be put to death.
verses.ct: Brothers will hand over their own brothers to be executed, and fathers will do the same to their children. Children will turn against their parents and have them put to death.

verses.kjv: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name’s sake: but he that endureth to the end shall be saved.
verses.ct: Everyone will hate you because of me. But whoever stands firm to the end will be saved.

verses.kjv: But when they persecute you in this city, flee ye into another: for verily I say unto you, Ye shall not have gone over the cities of Israel, till the Son of man be come.
verses.ct: When they persecute you in one city, escape to the next one. I tell you the truth, you won't finish going through all the cities of Israel before the Son of Man comes.

verses.kjv: The disciple is not above his master, nor the servant above his lord.
verses.ct: A student is not above the teacher, and a servant is not above the master.

verses.kjv: It is enough for the disciple that he be as his master, and the servant as his lord. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebub, how much more shall they call them of his household?
verses.ct: It's enough for students to become like their teacher and for servants to become like their master. If people have called the head of the house Beelzebub, how much worse will they treat the rest of his household!

verses.kjv: Fear them not therefore: for there is nothing covered, that shall not be revealed; and hid, that shall not be known.
verses.ct: So don't be afraid of them. Everything that is concealed will be uncovered, and every secret will be brought into the open.

verses.kjv: What I tell you in darkness, that speak ye in light: and what ye hear in the ear, that preach ye upon the housetops.
verses.ct: What I tell you in the dark, speak out in the daylight. What is whispered in your ear, announce from the rooftops.

verses.kjv: And fear not them which kill the body, but are not able to kill the soul: but rather fear him which is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.
verses.ct: Don't be afraid of those who can kill the body but can't kill the soul. Instead, be in awe of the one who has the power to destroy both soul and body in hell.

verses.kjv: Are not two sparrows sold for a farthing? and one of them shall not fall on the ground without your Father.
verses.ct: Aren't 2 sparrows sold for a tiny coin? Yet not a single one of them falls to the ground apart from your Father's knowledge.

verses.kjv: But the very hairs of your head are all numbered.
verses.ct: Even every hair on your head has been counted.

verses.kjv: Fear ye not therefore, ye are of more value than many sparrows.
verses.ct: So don't be afraid — you are worth far more than many sparrows.

verses.kjv: Whosoever therefore shall confess me before men, him will I confess also before my Father which is in heaven.
verses.ct: Whoever publicly acknowledges me in front of others, I will also acknowledge in front of my Father in heaven.

verses.kjv: But whosoever shall deny me before men, him will I also deny before my Father which is in heaven.
verses.ct: But whoever publicly disowns me in front of others, I will also disown in front of my Father in heaven.

verses.kjv: Think not that I am come to send peace on earth: I came not to send peace, but a sword.
verses.ct: Don't assume that I came to bring peace to the earth. I didn't come to bring peace, but a sword.

verses.kjv: For I am come to set a man at variance against his father, and the daughter against her mother, and the daughter in law against her mother in law.
verses.ct: I have come to turn a man against his father, a daughter against her mother, and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.

verses.kjv: And a man’s foes shall be they of his own household.
verses.ct: A person's enemies will be the members of their own family.

verses.kjv: He that loveth father or mother more than me is not worthy of me: and he that loveth son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me.
verses.ct: Anyone who loves their father or mother more than me doesn't deserve me, and anyone who loves their son or daughter more than me doesn't deserve me.

verses.kjv: And he that taketh not his cross, and followeth after me, is not worthy of me.
verses.ct: Anyone who doesn't pick up their cross and follow me doesn't deserve me.

verses.kjv: He that findeth his life shall lose it: and he that loseth his life for my sake shall find it.
verses.ct: Whoever clings to their life will lose it, and whoever gives up their life for my sake will find it.

verses.kjv: He that receiveth you receiveth me, and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me.
verses.ct: Whoever welcomes you welcomes me, and whoever welcomes me welcomes the one who sent me.

verses.kjv: He that receiveth a prophet in the name of a prophet shall receive a prophet’s reward; and he that receiveth a righteous man in the name of a righteous man shall receive a righteous man’s reward.
verses.ct: Whoever welcomes a prophet because that person is a prophet will receive a prophet's reward. And whoever welcomes a righteous person because that person is righteous will receive a righteous person's reward.

verses.kjv: And whosoever shall give to drink unto one of these little ones a cup of cold water only in the name of a disciple, verily I say unto you, he shall in no wise lose his reward.
verses.ct: I tell you the truth, whoever gives even just a cup of cold water to one of these little ones because they are my disciple will certainly not lose their reward."
